## Scalability Requirements

- THE system SHALL be scalable to accommodate up to 100,000 registered members, supporting a proportional increase in content, moderation actions, and reporting events without degradation in user experience.
- WHERE growth in geographic diversity occurs, THE system SHALL ensure that average response times for any user role remain below 3 seconds for users world-wide under nominal load conditions.
- WHEN data storage approaches 80% of projected annual volume, THE system SHALL enable seamless expansion, with no more than 1 hour of planned maintenance affecting non-critical (guest-only) read access.

## Availability Targets

- THE system SHALL maintain at least 99.95% uptime per quarter, measured as availability to members, moderators, and administrators.
- WHERE planned maintenance is required, THE system SHALL provide at least 72 hours advance notice to all users, with maintenance windows scheduled to minimize impact based on user activity analytics.
- IF unexpected downtime occurs, THEN THE system SHALL display a business-branded error page with clear recovery expectations and an estimate for service restoration.
- THE system SHALL support full recovery to the last consistent state within 10 minutes after critical failure.
- WHERE occur regional outages, THE system SHALL redirect users to a status page displaying ongoing incident information and alternate channels for urgent support (for moderators and administrators).

#### Mermaid Diagram: Uptime & Recovery Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["System Online"] --> B["Scheduled Maintenance"]
  A --> C["Unexpected Failure"]
  B --> D["Advance Notice to Users"]
  C --> E["Error Page with ETA"]
  C --> F["Begin Auto-Restoration"]
  F --> G["Restore Last Consistent State"]
  G --> H["System Online"]
```

## Data Privacy and Compliance

- THE system SHALL protect all user data in conformance with GDPR and local data privacy regulations relevant to target user geographies.
- WHEN a member, moderator, or administrator updates their personal data, THE system SHALL immediately reflect those changes across all stored records and audit logs.
- WHEN a user requests deletion of their account and data, THE system SHALL irreversibly remove personal data within 7 days, except data required for legal compliance or community business records (as detailed in legal references).
- WHERE user consent is needed for data collection or analytics, THE system SHALL present a consent mechanism at first interaction and honor subsequent revocation requests without impairing basic service access (when possible).
- IF unintentional exposure of personal data occurs, THEN THE system SHALL notify affected users and regulatory authorities within 72 hours of discovery, and provide a transparent remediation plan.
- THE system SHALL enforce data retention limits of 7 years for all policy/audit logs and 2 years for routine content (posts, comments, reactions, reports), unless stricter requirements apply locally.

### Data Privacy Table
| Data Type       | Retention Duration | Erasable by User | Compliance Standard             |
|-----------------|-------------------|------------------|---------------------------------|
| Personal Info   | 7 years max       | Yes              | GDPR/Local Regulation           |
| Content         | 2 years           | Yes (by owner)   | Platform Policy                 |
| Audit Logs      | 7 years           | No               | Legal Requirement               |
| Moderation Data | Until resolution  | N/A              | Community Compliance            |

## Accessibility Considerations

- THE system SHALL support accessibility in accordance with WCAG 2.1 AA standards for all user-facing interactions, regardless of role.
- WHEN a guest, member, moderator, or administrator uses assistive technology, THE system SHALL ensure full navigation, basic content interaction, and participation in discussions without functional barriers.
- WHERE new features are deployed, THE system SHALL include accessibility assessment as part of the launch business criteria.
- THE system SHALL provide a method for users to report accessibility issues, which SHALL be acknowledged within 48 hours and resolved within 30 days.
- THE system SHALL support localized experience (EN-US first, future support for other languages) for all content and notifications, with correct formatting for dates, times, and currency symbols where relevant.

## Success Criteria and Measurement

- THE system SHALL be continuously monitored against all non-functional KPIs:
   - Average response time <2 seconds
   - Uptime >=99.95%
   - Successful user deletion compliance rate >=99.99%
   - Accessibility issue resolution SLA <30 days
- KPIs SHALL be reviewed quarterly and inform ongoing business investment and operational improvement decisions.

## Cross-Cutting Concerns & Edge Cases

- WHEN exceptional spikes occur outside predicted schedules (e.g., news-driven surges), THE system SHALL prioritize core business functions (content submission, moderation, legal compliance) over non-essential processes (bulk exports).
- IF disaster events (e.g., major datacenter failures, legal injunctions) disrupt normal operations, THEN THE system SHALL enable rapid failover to a backup region, with maximal loss of 10 minutes of activity data.
- THE system SHALL provide clear error messaging and self-serve recovery paths for all user roles whenever a non-functional threshold is breached, including links to more information and support.

# External Integrations Requirements for politicalEconomicBoard

## 1. Introduction

### 1.1 Scope and Objective

THE politicalEconomicBoard SHALL integrate with external services to fulfill business requirements for content moderation, analytics and reporting, notification delivery (email, SMS, etc.), and, where necessary, optional single sign-on (SSO) for enterprise or institutional access. Every integration SHALL preserve seamless user experience, system security, full scalability, and regulatory/data compliance for all defined user roles.

THE system SHALL state WHAT integrations must deliver in business and user terms; technical, API, or implementation-level details SHALL be at the discretion of developers.

### 1.2 Integration Principles

THE system SHALL ensure all integrations:
- Support a seamless and transparent user experience, with no perceptible workflow disruption.
- Adhere to all legal privacy, security, and company policy requirements for third-party data exchanges.
- Scale with community, ensuring performance for guest, member, moderator, and administrator at all activity levels.
- Comply with statutory, regulatory, and internal controls for audit readiness and business continuity.

Details about compliance and operational baselines are in the [Non-Functional Requirements and Compliance Documentation](./07-non-functional-requirements.md).

## 2. Third-Party Moderation Integration

### 2.1 Moderation Workflow Requirements

WHEN a member submits any post or comment, THE system SHALL submit the content for automated moderation via a third-party service. THE system SHALL not publish content until moderation is complete, except for drafts explicitly saved by users.

WHEN a moderator or administrator reviews member-reported content, THE system SHALL display moderation analysis and recommendations from the external moderation provider as primary evidence for decision-making.

WHEN the external moderation is inconclusive, delayed, or returns an error, THE system SHALL queue the content for prioritized human review by moderators, marking it as "pending moderation" to all user roles.

### 2.2 Business Rules for Content Handling

THE system SHALL block publication of content assigned "high-risk" or "prohibited" status by the moderation provider.

WHEN content is flagged as "questionable," THE system SHALL display a status of "manual review required" and notify moderators to act within the next available review cycle.

THE system SHALL always notify the member creator when their submission is delayed, flagged, blocked, or otherwise affected by moderation.

WHEN a moderator acts on third-party flagged content, THE system SHALL record the decision and notification trail for audit.

### 2.3 Decision and Escalation Logic

IF moderation service response time is above 8 seconds, THEN THE system SHALL provide an immediate message to the content creator, stating the content is "pending review," with the option to save as a draft, and SHALL not lose any user input.

WHEN third-party moderation is unavailable or fails, THE system SHALL enable queuing of new submissions, clearly informing users that moderation is delayed and providing expected time for review.

WHEN an automated moderation result is disputed, challenged, or appealed by a member, THE system SHALL record the appeal, assign it for moderator attention, and inform users about expected handling timelines and escalation logic.

### 2.4 Error and Exception Scenarios

IF third-party moderation returns an error, timeout, or inconclusive result, THEN THE system SHALL:
- not publish or delete content automatically;
- place it in a system-held "pending" state visible only to its author, moderators, and administrators;
- require explicit moderator decision before publication or rejection.

WHEN moderation results are missing or delayed, THE system SHALL maintain submission state indefinitely or until a moderator takes action.

### 2.5 Performance and Response Expectations

THE system SHALL process and return moderation status for typical post/comment submissions under 2000 characters within 8 seconds for 95% of cases. WHEN processing delays exceed 8 seconds, THE system SHALL clearly notify the user with precise reason and next steps.

WHEN moderation decisions are outstanding for more than 1 hour, THE system SHALL escalate to moderators directly and provide administrators with system-level performance reports.

### 2.6 Role-based Access and Triggers

- Only member, moderator, and administrator submissions invoke moderation integration; guest browsing actions SHALL never trigger moderation flows.
- Moderators and administrators SHALL access detailed moderation data (result scores, test links, vendor comments) for informed review; members can view only moderation status and resolution of their own content.
- WHEN manual review is needed, THE system SHALL notify the next-available moderator and, if delayed more than 4 hours, escalate to administrators.

### 2.7 Moderation Integration Flow Diagram

```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Member Submits Content"] --> B["Send to Moderation Service"]
  B --> C{"Moderation Result"}
  C -->|"Approved"| D["Publish Content"]
  C -->|"High Risk"| E["Block Content, Notify User"]
  C -->|"Questionable"| F["Queue for Manual Moderator Review"]
  C -->|"Error/Timeout"| G["Mark Pending, Notify Moderator"]
  F --> H["Moderator Review"]
  H --> I{"Final Decision"}
  I -->|"Approve"| D
  I -->|"Block"| E
```

## 3. Analytics and Reporting Integration

### 3.1 Business Needs for Analytics

THE system SHALL integrate an analytics solution capable of:
- measuring DAU/MAU (Daily/Monthly Active Users) with role-based segmentation; 
- reporting most viewed topics, prolific contributors, and high-engagement content;
- tracking post/comment/reaction/flag rates;
- measuring moderation workflow duration (from report to resolution);
- calculating user retention, churn, ban, and appeal metrics for continuous business analysis.

### 3.2 Data Collection Rules

WHEN users interact with any of: post/comment creation, voting/reactions, reporting, login/logout, THE system SHALL enqueue and transmit anonymized event data to the analytics service with accurate timestamps, role, and content context. No personally identifiable information (PII) SHALL be sent to analytics providers.

WHERE PII or pseudonymized data transmission is required for business reporting, THE system SHALL encrypt and minimize data in compliance with [Non-Functional Requirements and Compliance Documentation](./07-non-functional-requirements.md).

### 3.3 Reporting Processes

Admins and product managers SHALL configure dashboards and schedule both recurring and ad-hoc reports containing pre-defined and customizable business metrics. Scheduled analytics SHALL be available as downloadable reports and/or via periodic email/SMS summaries.

WHEN traffic spikes, potential spam attacks, or moderation bottlenecks are detected through analytics, THE system SHALL trigger immediate alerts and dashboards to be sent to responsible roles (moderators, administrators, support staff).

### 3.4 Data Privacy and Security

THE system SHALL transmit only pseudonymized or aggregated data externally as per legal requirements; consent mechanisms and opt-out flows SHALL be available per data privacy policy.

WHEN a user revokes analytics consent, THE system SHALL cease event forwarding for non-mandatory actions, logging consent status and enforcement automatically.

### 3.5 Performance/Reactivity Criteria

THE system SHALL transmit analytics events in asynchronous batches or streams, ensuring no user-visible delay in foreground system performance. WHEN event queue backlogs or failures are detected, THE system SHALL notify system administrators within 1 minute and log all outage and recovery attempts for audit purposes.

### 3.6 Integration Triggers and User Scenarios

WHEN new product features are enabled or workflows changed, THE system SHALL update the analytics integration for new event types within 48 hours of a business stakeholder request, and document the mapping for audit compliance.

## 4. Notification Channels Integration (Email, SMS, etc.)

### 4.1 Types of Notifications

THE system SHALL provide notifications for user and business events via email (default), with SMS/other channels as opt-in. Supported events SHALL include:
- Account registration, verification, password reset
- Post/comment status changes (approval, block, edit, appeal outcome)
- Direct messages or replies (if implemented)
- Votes/reactions received on user content (digest)
- Platform-wide announcements, policy or compliance updates

### 4.2 Triggering Events and Business Rules

WHEN an event requiring notification occurs (e.g., registration, password reset, post blocked, reaction received), THE system SHALL dispatch a notification immediately for time-sensitive events (account, moderation decisions), or as part of a digest within 30 minutes for less urgent events (votes, reactions).

WHEN a user is subject to discipline (e.g. post blocked, account restricted), THE system SHALL issue a notification citing the rationale, policy reference, and next possible appeal or action.

WHEN a staff role receives a report escalation, THE system SHALL deliver confidential notifications exclusively to moderators/administrators, including appropriate context and summary evidence.

### 4.3 Message Customization and Localization Requirements

THE system SHALL support fully localized notification content for all supported user languages, defaulting to en-US. Each notification template SHALL be maintainable by administrators, with versioning for policy or legal content updates. All user notifications SHALL reflect user language preference at the time they registered/updated profile.

### 4.4 User Preferences and Opt-out Mechanisms

THE system SHALL provide members with a full dashboard to opt-in/out of notification types and channels, with each grouping (account, post, moderation, reaction, system announcements) individually configurable, except for legal/mandatory notices. Opt-out for essential alerts SHALL not be permitted.

WHEN a user opts out, THE system SHALL honor that choice for all non-mandatory messages within 24 hours. Notification suppression or unavailability SHALL be logged for audit.

### 4.5 Error Handling and Retry Logic

WHEN notification delivery fails (e.g. bounced email, undelivered SMS), THE system SHALL retry delivery up to 2 times within 10 minutes. IF all attempts fail, THEN THE system SHALL log the failure and (where another channel is available and opted-in) attempt redelivery using alternate channels, also notifying the user of a potential communication issue at their next login.

WHEN administrators observe repeated notification failures, THE system SHALL provide tools to investigate delivery logs, view most common errors, and update notification settings/templates as needed.

### 4.6 Performance Criteria

THE system SHALL ensure transactional (account/moderation) notifications are delivered within 60 seconds of the triggering event and digest notifications within the interval set by business rules. Audit trails for notification delivery and failure SHALL be accessible to moderators and administrators.

### 4.7 Notification Flow Sequence Diagram

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
  participant U as "User"
  participant S as "System"
  participant N as "Notification Service"

  U->>S: Perform Action (register, post, comment, etc.)
  S->>N: Send Notification Event Data
  N-->>S: Confirm Delivery Status
  S-->>U: Show Real-Time Feedback (opt-in settings)
  N-->>U: Deliver Notification via Email/SMS (localized)
```

## 5. Single Sign-On (Optional)

### 5.1 SSO Needs and Supported Providers

WHERE required for enterprise/academic onboarding, THE system SHALL support SSO using Google, Microsoft, and SAML-compliant providers. SSO enablement, allowed IDPs, and SSO role mapping SHALL be configurable by administrators.

### 5.2 User Journey and Role Mapping

WHEN a new user authenticates via SSO, THE system SHALL create a unique member profile and record the identity provider, role mapping, and origin context.

WHERE SSO is enabled, THE system SHALL apply externally provided group/claim information to correct role assignment per [User Roles and Authentication Documentation](./02-user-roles-and-authentication.md). All mapped privileges SHALL be logged and auditable.

### 5.3 Business Logic for Account Linking and Creation

WHEN an existing member links an SSO identity, THE system SHALL:
- verify user’s email and profile integrity;
- associate any previous history regardless of sign-on method;
- preserve reputation, content, and preferences.

Disallowed duplicate linking or identity mismatches SHALL trigger a support workflow and not allow profile creation without administrator review.

### 5.4 Security and Compliance Requirements

THE system SHALL not store or process external IDP passwords at any point. Only federated, token-based authentication SHALL be used.

SSO integrations SHALL conform with all legal, regulatory, and privacy requirements for enterprise and jurisdiction in which the platform operates; system SHALL routinely export compliance logs for administrator review.

WHEN SSO role/configuration is changed by administrators, THE system SHALL require re-confirmation of all mappings and notify affected users.

### 5.5 Error Scenarios

IF an SSO provider is unreachable, THEN THE system SHALL direct affected users to standard login with a clear message, and capture the failed attempt for audit.

IF required user info (email, role claims) cannot be securely retrieved from the provider, THEN THE system SHALL not create the account and instruct the user to complete registration manually or contact support.

WHEN duplicate or conflicting SSO accounts are detected, THE system SHALL alert the user and staff for resolution, placing access into a "pending" or "locked" state pending verification.

## 6. General Requirements and Constraints

THE system SHALL log all critical integration actions and third-party failures for audit by administrators. All integration endpoints SHALL be actively monitored for uptime, performance, and error volume. Administrators SHALL be able to toggle, update, or put integrations into "safe mode" to prevent user disruption if an external dependency is degraded or noncompliant.

WHEN a third-party integration fails, and user flow can be safely continued without risk, THE system SHALL provide customized messages to users and gracefully degrade non-core features.

WHEN legal or compliance hazard is detected at an integration point (e.g., privacy violation, terms-of-service issue), THE system SHALL immediately suspend integration, alert support staff, and place related platform actions into a "manual review only" mode until resolution.

All integrations and endpoints SHALL be documented, monitored, and included in administrator activity audits.

## 7. References to Related Documents

- For user role logic and permission requirements: [User Roles and Authentication Specification](./02-user-roles-and-authentication.md).
- For business rules and platform interactions: [Functional Requirements Documentation](./03-functional-requirements.md).
- For system error, recovery, and exception flows: [Error Handling and Edge Cases Guide](./06-error-handling-and-edge-cases.md).
- For privacy, legal/compliance, and operational standards: [Non-Functional Requirements and Compliance Documentation](./07-non-functional-requirements.md).

| Voting/Reactions            | Vote or reaction event    | member      | Auth, quota (once/item)        | WHEN a member votes/reacts, THE system SHALL record it and disallow duplicate on same item/user.   |
| Moderation Actions          | Reason, item/action/meta  | moderator   | Justification, rule checks     | WHEN a moderator acts, THE system SHALL require valid reason and log action with timestamp.         |
| Reports Filed               | Report reason/meta        | member      | Duplicate, valid reason        | WHEN a member files a report, THE system SHALL log it and trigger moderation review process.        |
| Content Appeals             | Appeal request/metadata   | member      | Ownership, timeout             | WHEN a member or moderator appeals an action, THE system SHALL validate timeliness and eligibility. |
| Administrative Configs      | Settings, role changes    | administrator | Auth, justification             | WHEN an administrator performs critical changes, THE system SHALL enforce audit trail and review.   |

### Input Validation and Feedback
- WHEN invalid data is detected (e.g., poorly formed email, forbidden content), THE system SHALL reject submission and provide precise feedback within 2 seconds.
- WHEN submission exceeds allowed quotas (posts/comments/votes), THE system SHALL block operation and inform of exact limit reason.
- WHEN policy violations are detected at entry, THE system SHALL trigger an error message referencing the breached rule, without exposing system internals.

## Content Publishing Flow

Content, once entered, transitions through a series of business-driven states before reaching the public. Every state change is governed by user roles, validation, moderation, and reporting triggers. Content includes posts, comments, votes, and reactions, each with a lifecycle tied to user, moderator, and system events.

### Standard Publishing Workflow

```mermaid
graph LR
  A["User Entry (Post/Comment)"] --> B{"Valid by Policy?"}
  B -->|"Yes"| C["Publish: Visible to All" ]
  B -->|"No"| D["Reject: Error Message" ]
  C --> E{"Reported?"}
  E -->|"No"| F["Open for Interaction" ]
  E -->|"Yes"| G["Flagged for Moderation" ]
  G --> H{"Severity > Threshold?"}
  H -->|"Yes"| I["Auto-Hide (Pending Review)" ]
  H -->|"No"| J["Stays Public under Review" ]
  I --> K["Moderator Review" ]
  J --> K
  K --> L{"Moderator Action?"}
  L -->|"Edit/Delete"| M["Modify or Remove" ]
  L -->|"Approve"| N["Restore/Stay Public" ]
```

### Lifecycle Requirements
- WHEN a member posts content, THE system SHALL associate authorship and timestamp, enforcing privacy policies per user role.
- THE system SHALL display new content to all permitted users within 1 second after passing validation.
- WHILE content is under moderation or appeal, THE system SHALL restrict edits only to moderators/administrators.
- WHEN content is auto-hidden or deleted by moderation, THE system SHALL log status, notify author, and trigger notification to relevant stakeholders (e.g., moderators, administrators).

### State Table: Content Publishing
| State         | Entry Trigger                | Role Permissions                     | Exit/Transition Trigger        |
|---------------|-----------------------------|--------------------------------------|-------------------------------|
| Draft         | User creation/edit           | Owner only (member)                  | Submit or discard             |
| Public        | Passes validation/mod review | All users (subject to view rights)   | Report > threshold/mod action |
| Flagged       | Sufficient report count      | Moderators, administrators           | Review/decision               |
| Auto-hidden   | High severity flag           | Moderators, administrators           | Review/decision               |
| Under Review  | Manual/Auto moderation       | Moderator, administrator             | Approval/removal/appeal       |
| Deleted       | Moderation/user deletion     | Admin/mod (withdrawn for public)     | Archive/permanent purge       |
| Archived      | Scheduled/triggered archive  | Administrator (view/audit only)      | Permanent deletion            |

## Moderation and Reporting Flow

Members and system automations can report content for violations, triggering review processes. Moderators are responsible for handling flagged items, supported by clear business logic for review, edit, deletion, and user escalation. Appeals and audits close the governance loop.

### Moderation/Reporting Workflow Diagram

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Reporting"
    A["Member Reports Content"]
    B["Report Count or Severity Exceeds Threshold"]
  end
  subgraph "Moderation Review"
    C["Moderator Receives Case"]
    D{"Rule Violation?"}
    E["Edit/Delete/Restrict Content"]
    F["Approve/Restore Content"]
    G["Notify Author/Reporter"]
  end
  subgraph "Escalation"
    H{"Appeal Submitted?"}
    I["Assign to Senior Moderator/Admin"]
    J{"Uphold or Reverse Action?"}
    K["Update Content Status"]
    L["Final Notify/Log"]
  end
  A --> B --> C
  C --> D
  D -->|"Yes"| E --> G
  D -->|"No"| F --> G
  G --> H
  H -->|"Yes"| I --> J
  J -->|"Uphold"| K --> L
  J -->|"Reverse"| K
  H -->|"No"| L
```

### Requirements for Reports and Moderation
- WHEN a report is filed, THE system SHALL lock the report to a unique moderator and timestamp initiation.
- IF report count or automated risk analysis exceeds critical threshold, THEN THE system SHALL immediately auto-hide content and notify moderators within 1 second.
- WHILE content is under review, THE system SHALL maintain prior status (public/hidden) unless policy demands masking.
- WHEN a moderator action is taken, THE system SHALL notify both the report originator and the content author with details, rationale, and appeal options within 2 seconds.
- IF an appeal is submitted within allowed policy window, THEN THE system SHALL escalate to a higher authority (admin/senior moderator) and lock content from further changes during review.
- THE system SHALL log every moderation action, notification, appeal, and governing rationale for up to 7 years for audit/compliance purposes.

### Edge Cases and Error Handling
- IF two moderators try to review or act upon the same content, THEN THE system SHALL prevent duplicate actions and assign the case to the first claimant.
- IF a user attempts to appeal after the allowed window, THEN THE system SHALL reject the appeal and indicate time limit expiry.
- WHEN content is deleted during an open moderation case, THE system SHALL complete the review process prior to final deletion.

## Archiving and Deletion Policy

Content, user data, and metadata transition from active use to archival and eventual deletion according to business and compliance requirements. Data retention is role- and policy-bound, with recovery, audit, and legal constraints.

### Data Lifecycle Diagram

```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Content Created"]
  B["Active (Public/Hidden)"]
  C["Archived"]
  D["Scheduled for Deletion"]
  E["Deleted (Soft Delete)"]
  F["Permanent Purge"]

  A --> B
  B -->|"Archive Trigger (Inactivity/Schedule)"| C
  C -->|"Mark for Deletion (Policy/User Request)"| D
  D -->|"Deletion/Retention Policy Elapsed"| E
  E -->|"Retention Expires/Audit OK"| F
```

### Retention and Recovery
- WHEN content is deleted by user request, THE system SHALL apply a soft-delete, retaining data for 180 days for potential restoration or audit, masked from public view.
- WHEN content is subject to regulatory/legal hold, THE system SHALL retain it indefinitely or until explicit release is granted by the responsible administrator.
- WHEN an audit or inquiry request is initiated during retention, THE system SHALL make all pertinent data available to administrators and compliance officers.
- WHEN user or system-initiated data archival occurs, THE system SHALL store data in an inaccessible archive, recoverable upon administrator approval.
- WHEN retention time expires without restoration, THE system SHALL permanently purge the data and erase all recoverable traces.

### User-Initiated Data and Privacy Actions
- WHEN a member requests erasure of their data, THE system SHALL initiate the deletion process within 24 hours, notify the requesting user, and complete physical removal of all personal data (aside from legal/audit logs) within 7 days.
- IF a user requests a copy or review of their retained content, THEN THE system SHALL deliver appropriately within legal timeframe (typically 30 days for standard cases).
- THE system SHALL honor privacy and erasure requests fully, except for data bound to open legal compliance, regulatory investigations, or active appeals.

### Administrator and Moderator Permissions
- Administrators are empowered to execute permanent deletions, force retention extensions, and release or unarchive data for legal or security purposes. Every action is logged.
- Moderators may execute soft deletes and initiate archiving according to incident management protocols, but cannot purge or override formal retention policies set at the administrative level.

## Lifecycle State Table
| State        | Who Can View        | Who Can Edit/Delete    | Typical Retention           | Recovery Path                  |
|--------------|--------------------|------------------------|-----------------------------|---------------------------------
| Active       | All eligible roles  | Owner/mod/admin        | Until flagged or archived   | Edit/delete (by right)         |
| Hidden       | Mod/admin           | Mod/admin              | Until review/outcome        | Restoration by mod/admin       |
| Archived     | Admin               | Admin                  | 2 years (default)           | Unarchive by admin             |
| Deleted (Soft) | Admin/for audit    | Only admin             | 180 days (default)          | Restore by admin if eligible   |
| Permanently Deleted | None          | None                   | N/A                         | Irrecoverable                  |

## Edge Cases, Errors, and Exceptional Scenarios
- IF content is requested for deletion but is under appeal/legal review, THEN THE system SHALL flag the deletion and hold action until the appeal or investigation completes.
- IF an admin attempts to permanently purge content before minimum retention period expires, THEN THE system SHALL block the attempt and notify admin of relevant policy.
- WHEN a user requests restoration of deleted content before retention expiry, THE system SHALL verify eligibility and, if compliant, restore data within 3 business days.
- IF archiving triggers fail (e.g., batch archive does not process), THEN THE system SHALL alert the admin within 1 hour and queue content for next available slot.
- WHEN a user attempts to access archived or deleted content, THE system SHALL deny access and display a retention-status message specifying next steps.

## Cross-Role Data Influence and Permissions

- Guest users are prohibited from altering or initiating any change in data state. All visible content is subject to global content filtering and privacy regulations.
- Members are limited to their own content modification; voting, reacting, and reporting abilities do not allow viewing or restoring deleted/archived items.
- Moderators are gatekeepers for content moderation, reporting-based state changes, and soft deletes, operating under explicit business validation rules and audit logging mandates.
- Administrators hold supreme authority in data lifecycle management, able to execute full deletions, unarchiving, recovery, legal holds, and manual overrides, logged for audit and compliance.

## Performance, Timeliness, and User Experience Requirements
- WHEN any data state transition occurs, THE system SHALL reflect changes in all user and moderation interfaces within 1 second under normal conditions.
- WHEN a legally or policy-mandated retention or deletion event is triggered, THE system SHALL process and log it within 24 hours.
- THE system SHALL process user erasure or privacy requests in under 7 days for all content outside restricted legal/audit holds.
- WHEN a user requests a data recovery (restore), THE system SHALL evaluate, respond, and, if eligible, process within 3 business days.
- IF automated or batch data flow routines fail, THEN THE system SHALL queue the event and alert system operators within 15 minutes for remediation.

## Summary
The data lifecycle on politicalEconomicBoard progresses through well-defined, policy-driven states impacted by user actions, business validation, moderation, reporting, and regulatory compliance. EARS-based requirements, robust auditing, permission boundaries, and visual diagrams ensure all user roles and administrative stakeholders can clearly navigate, govern, and enforce consistent data flow and lifecycle behaviors. No technical/database schema or API specifications are included; all requirements herein are implementation-ready for backend development using business rules and user-centric logic alone.

# Success Criteria and Monitoring Requirements for politicalEconomicBoard

## 1. Introduction

Defining clear, measurable success criteria and a robust monitoring framework ensures that the politicalEconomicBoard platform consistently meets its business objectives while enabling continuous improvement and rapid issue remediation. All requirements are stated to guide backend developers in implementing comprehensive metric collection, role-based segmentation, workflow monitoring, escalation procedures, and ongoing health audits in line with platform needs for engagement, quality, moderation, reliability, and operational excellence. Success is determined by tangible, reportable metrics and their timely review.

## 2. User Engagement Metrics

Meaningful engagement is essential for a thriving discourse community. User engagement must be rigorously measured, segmented by all roles, and reviewed for both volume and quality of participation.

### Quantitative Metrics
- Total number of posts and comments per day, week, and month per role (guest, member, moderator, administrator)
- Unique active logins daily, weekly, and monthly per role
- Number of voting and reaction actions (by role and content type)
- Thread depth, post longevity, and participation diversity per discussion

### Qualitative Metrics
- 7-day and 30-day returning user rates, per role
- New user onboarding-to-first-activity ratio by registration cohort
- Ratio of guest readers to active contributing members (conversion tracking)
- Content engagement patterns, e.g., average reactions/votes per post by topic and role

### Role-Based Engagement Tracking
- Segmentation and comparative analysis of guest, member, moderator, and administrator actions
- Tracking of moderator and administrator initiations/interventions (e.g., starting official discussions or interventions in threads)
- Monitoring member achievements, badges, or milestones for activity incentives

### EARS Requirements for Engagement
- THE system SHALL collect, calculate, and store all engagement metrics listed above for each user role and reporting interval.
- WHEN a registered member performs any engagement action (post, comment, vote, reaction), THE system SHALL update real-time and aggregate metrics instantly, visible to authorized staff.
- WHEN a moderator or administrator initiates an engagement action, THE system SHALL log both the action and its type for statistical analysis within 5 minutes.
- WHEN engagement KPIs drop below 80% of preceding month’s baseline, THE system SHALL notify administrators and initiate a review process within 24 hours.
- WHEN a data anomaly (e.g., drop-off, surge, missing data) is detected during metric processing, THE system SHALL flag it for administrative review, annotate the affected report, and retain raw data for error correction.
- WHERE abnormal inactivity is observed for 48 hours consecutively, THE system SHALL trigger a status check and send alert to staff.

### Edge Cases and Business Rules
- IF user actions cannot be recorded due to system downtime or data store issues, THEN THE system SHALL queue metric data for re-processing within 2 hours of service restoration and annotate dashboard reports with interruption warning.
- THE system SHALL restrict individual users, regardless of role, from inflating engagement via automated or abusive means, implementing threshold checks and human audit triggers for outlier activity patterns.

### Workflow Example: Engagement Metric Cycle
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["User Performs Action"] --> B["System Updates Real-Time Metric"]
  B --> C{"Is Action by Staff?"}
  C -->|"Yes"| D["Log Staff Engagement by Type"]
  C -->|"No"| E["Record Standard Engagement"]
  D --> F["Aggregate and Report"]
  E --> F
  F --> G{"Data Anomaly?"}
  G -->|"Yes"| H["Flag for Admin Review"]
  G -->|"No"| I["Update KPIs/Dashboard"]
```

## 3. Content Quality Metrics

Content quality defines the board’s credibility and value. Quality measurement must blend automated and moderator-driven processes, be timely, and enable action on low/high-quality content.

### Core Quality Indicators
- Ratio of original to duplicate/reposted content submissions
- Average reaction/vote score per post, subdivided by content category and user role
- Number of posts assigned high-quality status by moderators or automated process
- Total reports of factual inaccuracy, violations, or off-topic content per posted item
- Frequency of manual content reviews, outcome distribution, and rationale capture

### EARS Requirements for Content Quality
- WHEN any post or comment is submitted or edited, THE system SHALL perform quality assessment via both automated rules and enable moderator review within 1 hour.
- IF a post or comment accrues more than a platform-defined threshold of negative votes, factual challenge reports, or quality complaints, THEN THE system SHALL flag it for moderator review within 2 hours and notify the author.
- WHERE content is marked as high quality (either by moderator rating, member consensus, or automated scoring), THE system SHALL reflect this status in both weekly dashboards and user profiles.
- THE system SHALL log all moderation or audit decisions with rationale for transparency.
- WHEN a member appeals a quality downgrade or negative content assessment, THE system SHALL initiate a secondary review by another moderator within 48 hours.
- IF editing or correcting content triggers another quality assessment, THEN THE system SHALL update quality metrics within 30 minutes of the change.

### Workflow Example: Content Quality Monitoring and Escalation
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Content Submitted"] --> B["Automated Quality Scan"]
  B --> C{"Flagged for Review?"}
  C -->|"Yes"| D["Assign Moderator Review"]
  D --> E["Moderator Renders Decision"]
  E --> F["Log Rationale, Update Status"]
  C -->|"No"| G["Mark as Normal Quality"]
  E --> H{"Appeal Filed?"}
  H -->|"Yes"| I["Re-review by Alternate Moderator"]
  H -->|"No"| J["Report to KPI Dashboards"]
```

### Edge Cases and Quality Validation
- IF automated scans fail or return inconclusive results, THEN THE system SHALL assign manual review and track scan error rates weekly.
- IF false-positive rates for quality downgrades exceed agreed threshold (e.g., 3%), THEN THE system SHALL initiate a cross-team review.
- WHEN duplicate or reposted content is detected, THE system SHALL notify the original poster/author and merge or annotate reposts.
- THE system SHALL provide authors with structured feedback for any manual quality downgrade.

## 4. Moderation Effectiveness

Effective moderation preserves safety and trust. Monitoring must trace intervention speed, resolution quality, fairness, and appeal outcomes across all roles.

### Moderation Metrics
- Volume of reported posts/comments per week, segmented by reason and severity
- Median time from report submission to first moderator response and to final resolution
- Proportion and distribution of reports resolved at each escalation level (moderator, administrator)
- Frequency of resolved, escalated, and appealed actions, with typical turnaround times
- Breakdown of user satisfaction (where feedback is collected) on moderation outcomes per role

### EARS Requirements for Moderation
- WHEN a user (member, moderator, or admin) submits a report, THE system SHALL immediately notify relevant moderators and log the event for traceability.
- WHEN a report is opened, THE system SHALL capture timestamps for each review stage (first review, action, closure, appeal initiation, final decision).
- IF a moderator fails to respond within a 4-hour window, THEN THE system SHALL escalate the report to an administrator and inform affected users.
- THE system SHALL generate weekly reports summarizing moderation volume, response/turnaround times by case type, and unresolved/overdue cases.
- WHEN an appeal is filed and not acted upon within 48 hours, THE system SHALL auto-escalate to the next authority level.
- THE system SHALL track and analyze outcomes where moderation reviewed content is reinstated after appeal, flagging patterns for process improvement.

### Edge Cases and Moderation Rules
- IF multiple moderators act on the same report simultaneously, THEN THE system SHALL lock the report for the first reviewer and inform others of ongoing action.
- WHEN a moderation decision is reversed by appeal, THE system SHALL restore content and reputation, notifying all involved parties.
- IF automated moderation services are unavailable, THEN THE system SHALL route all reports to manual review and annotate dashboard with service disruption alerts.

### Moderation and Appeal Workflow
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Report Submitted"] --> B["Assign Moderator"]
  B --> C{"Response Within 4h?"}
  C -->|"Yes"| D["Review and Decision"]
  C -->|"No"| E["Escalate to Admin"]
  D --> F{"Appeal Filed?"}
  F -->|"Yes"| G["Re-review by New Moderator/Admin"]
  F -->|"No"| H["Log and Report Closure"]
  G --> H
  E --> I{"Resolved?"}
  I -->|"Yes"| H
  I -->|"No"| J["Notify Stakeholders, Flag Overdue"]
```

## 5. Uptime and Reliability

Uptime and reliability are non-negotiable for mission-critical civic discourse; requirements must focus on detection, proactive notification, and swift resolution of incidents and degradations.

### Availability Targets
- Target: >=99.9% service uptime per calendar month
- Visible, advance communication of all maintenance windows to all user roles

### Monitoring and Logging Requirements
- THE system SHALL run continuous health checks on all platform services and core dependencies (including third-party integrations) every minute.
- WHEN a health check fails, THE system SHALL generate a real-time alert to administrators and record the event in a permanent incident log.
- THE system SHALL log all interruptions, maintenance events, and incident resolutions with detailed root cause, impact, affected users, and time-to-resolution.
- IF downtime exceeds 15 accumulated minutes in any rolling 30-day period, THEN THE system SHALL trigger a mandatory post-incident reliability review and document required mitigation actions in an internal knowledge base.

### EARS Requirements and Escalation Flows
- IF service degradation is detected or user complaints about accessibility rise above normal baseline, THEN THE system SHALL trigger immediate escalation and display real-time status banners to all users.
- WHEN an uptime SLA breach is imminent, THE system SHALL alert administrators and log all steps taken during the recovery process.
- WHEN repeated failures (2+ incidents/month) occur in core system areas, THE system SHALL assign a task force for in-depth review, requiring a closure summary and future-proofing plan within 7 days.

### Reliability and Incident Response Workflow
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["System Health Check"] --> B{"Health Issue Detected?"}
  B -->|"No"| C["Continue Monitoring"]
  B -->|"Yes"| D["Alert Admins & Log Incident"]
  D --> E["Initiate Recovery/Failover"]
  E --> F{"Within 15m?"}
  F -->|"Yes"| G["Incident Closed, Post-mortem"]
  F -->|"No"| H["Mandatory Mitigation Review"]
  G --> I["Resume Normal Ops, Publish Report"]
  H --> I
```

### Edge Cases and Special Scenarios
- IF monitoring services are impaired or offline, THEN THE system SHALL redundantly log diagnostic traces for retroactive analysis and enable manual health-check protocol by administrators.
- THE system SHALL provide grace periods for maintenance during off-peak hours, as determined by historical activity data per user role.

## 6. Continuous Improvement Processes

Sustained service value is driven by regular metric review, feedback integration, and corrective action cycles that address all key user roles and organizational objectives.

### Feedback and Review
- THE system SHALL accept structured user and staff feedback year-round via web forms, in-app prompts, and direct moderator channels.
- WHEN feedback is submitted, THE system SHALL log submitter role, context, and feedback type for quarterly aggregation and thematic analysis.
- THE system SHALL enable direct follow-up or survey requests to select users based on feedback patterns and recent incidents.
- WHEN thresholds for engagement, quality, or reliability metrics are missed for two consecutive review periods, THE system SHALL require a formal root-cause analysis and documented improvement plan.

### Transparency, Reporting, and Corrective Actions
- THE system SHALL publish high-level metric dashboards and quarterly summary reports to authorized administrators, with options for community transparency subject to role permissions.
- WHEN corrective actions are identified, THE system SHALL assign owners, deadlines, and status tracking for each action, requiring closure and verification within agreed timelines.
- IF corrective actions are overdue or recurring failures are detected, THEN THE system SHALL notify management for escalation.
- THE system SHALL allow users to subscribe to success metric updates and publish guidance on how feedback is incorporated.

### Continuous Improvement Workflow
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Metric Data and Feedback Collected"] --> B["Quarterly Analysis Meeting"]
  B --> C{"Thresholds Met?"}
  C -->|"Yes"| D["Publish Dashboard/Report"]
  C -->|"No"| E["Initiate Root Cause Review"]
  E --> F["Define and Assign Actions"]
  F --> G["Track/Verify Resolution"]
  G --> D
```

### Edge Cases and Exception Paths
- IF metric review or improvement meetings are skipped for any reason, THEN THE system SHALL escalate to board-level administrators and record reasons for missed cycles.
- WHEN data reliability is questioned due to anomalies, THE system SHALL initiate independent audit trails.

## 7. Success Criteria Table (Summary)

| Metric Area             | Target/Threshold                                   | Reporting Frequency              |
|------------------------|----------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------|
| Engagement             | Weekly engagement growth; ≥50% monthly return      | Weekly, Monthly                  |
| Content Quality        | >80% posts/comments rated high or above            | Weekly                           |
| Moderation Response    | <4h median to first moderator response             | Weekly                           |
| Reported Content Flow  | ≥98% reports resolved within 48h                   | Weekly                           |
| Uptime                 | ≥99.9% uptime per month, <15m downtime             | Monthly, Incident-based          |
| Continuous Improvement | Quarterly review, published actions, 100% closure  | Quarterly                        |

## 8. Related Documents and Further Reading

- [Non-Functional Platform Requirements](./07-non-functional-requirements.md)
